tables.name: Capability
tables.summary: Functional affordances and primitives the system can provide.
tables.why_separate: Capability is compositional (a Lego inventory). Mixing capability with evidence or principles blurs what can be done with what must be proven or must never happen.
tables.collapse_risk: Domain collapse creates false precision: capability claims look satisfied while evidence and constraints are silently missing, causing waiver inflation and audit fanfiction.

tables.name: Evidence
tables.summary: Artifacts required to justify claims (receipts, tests, attestations, audits).
tables.why_separate: Evidence is not a feature. It is the verification surface that turns claims into audited truth. If it is not its own table it gets hand-waved into prose and disappears.
tables.collapse_risk: Without a dedicated evidence table, proof obligations degrade into optional documentation and the system loses the ability to bind claims to reproducible receipts.

tables.name: Experience
tables.summary: Surface reality and lived outcomes (UX shape, product expectations, user-observed behavior).
tables.why_separate: Experience requirements are not engineering guarantees. Mixing experience with capability produces the illusion that aesthetics or product intent were formally proven.
tables.collapse_risk: If experience is collapsed into capability or evidence, the checker starts proving vibes (UI wishes) or punishing valid designs for not matching a single aesthetic worldview.

tables.name: Principle
tables.summary: Global invariants and constraints (non-custodial posture, determinism, safety boundaries).
tables.why_separate: Principles are non-negotiable invariants, not optional features. Treating them as capabilities makes them negotiable, which is where systems rot.
tables.collapse_risk: Principle collapse makes invariants look like toggles; exceptions become normal; waivers become the primary mechanism; trust evaporates.

tables.name: Workshop
tables.summary: Build and operations workflow mechanics (how the system is produced, maintained, and operated).
tables.why_separate: The same capabilities can be built with radically different workflows and failure modes. Workshop captures the process-physics that determines reproducibility and operational truth.
tables.collapse_risk: If workshop is merged into capability, build/ops constraints become invisible and you get non-reproducible systems with perfect-looking specs and catastrophic delivery drift.
